revised_title: Phosphorus-Base Research: Phosphoretted Ureas and Analogues
tldr: The author, A.W. Hofmann, conducted research on phosphorus-bases and discovered a new group of compounds containing nitrogen and phosphorus, which he called phosphamines. He synthesized a phosphoretted urea, a compound similar to urea but with phosphorus replacing one equivalent of nitrogen. This new compound, called cyanurate of phenyl, has potential applications in the field of organic chemistry and crystallography.
